name: Make You Feel My Love
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
When the rain is blowing in your face
And the whole world is on your case
I could offer you a warm embrace
To make you feel my love

[Verse 2]
When the evening shadows and the stars appear
And there is no one there to dry your tears
I could hold you for a million years
To make you feel my love

[Bridge 1]
I know you haven't made your mind up yet
But I will never do you wrong
I've known it from the moment that we met
No doubt in my mind where you belong

[Verse 3]
I'd go hungry, I'd go black and blue
I'd go crawling down the avenue
Know there's nothing that I wouldn't do
To make you feel my love

[Instrumental break]
[Bridge 2]
The storms are raging on the rollin' sea
And on the highway of regret
The winds of change are blowing wild and free
You ain't seen nothing like me yet

[Verse 4]
I could make you happy, make your dreams come true
Nothing that I wouldn't do
Go to the ends of the earth for you
To make you feel my love
To make you feel my love

name: Your Song
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
It's a little bit funny, this feeling inside
I'm not one of those who can easily hide
I don't have much money, but, boy, if I did
I'd buy a big house where we both could live
If I was a sculptor, heh, but then again, no
Or a man who makes potions in a traveling show
I know it's not much, but it's the best I can do
My gift is my song, and this one's for you

[Chorus]
And you can tell everybody this is your song
It may be quite simple, but now that it's done
I hope you don't mind, I hope you don't mind
That I put down in words
How wonderful life is while you're in the world

[Verse 2]
I sat on the roof and kicked off the moss
Well, a few of the verses, well, they've got me quite cross
But the sun's been quite kind while I wrote this song
It's for people like you that keep it turned on
So excuse me forgetting, but these things I do
You see, I've forgotten if they're green or they're blue
Anyway, the thing is, what I really mean
Yours are the sweetest eyes I've ever seen
[Chorus]
And you can tell everybody this is your song
It may be quite simple, but now that it's done
I hope you don't mind, I hope you don't mind
That I put down in words
How wonderful life is while you're in the world

[Outro]
I hope you don't mind, I hope you don't mind
That I put down in words
How wonderful life is while you're in the world
annotations:
[('I hope you don’t mind, I hope you don’t mind
 That I put down in words', [['He doesn´t know how this person is going to react to his song. He thinks that his love isn´t reciprocated']]), ('My gift is my song, and this one’s for you', [['Although Elton John didn’t write the lyrics, Taupin knew that he was gay. It seems that Elton John is saying that because he can’t express his love publicly, the best he can do at the minute is express his love through this song.']]), ('How wonderful life is while you’re in the world', [['A beautiful one-liner to close: life is so much better when those “blessings” are around us (partners, children, friends, family)']]), ('I sat on the roof and kicked off the moss', [['The writer of the lyrics, Bernie Taupin, allegedly wrote the song’s lyrics after breakfast one morning on the roof of 20 Denmark Street, London, where John worked for a music publishing firm as an office boy.']]), ('Well, a few of the verses, well, they’ve got me quite cross', [['Made him feel “cross”?

According to an interview with Cameron Crowe in The Uncool, Elton said:

I remember writing it at my parents’ apartment in North London, and Bernie giving me the lyrics, sitting down at the piano and looking at it and going, ‘Oh, my God, this is such a great lyric, I can’t fuck this one up.’ It came out in about 20 minutes, and when I was done, I called him in and we both knew. I was 22, and he was 19, and it gave us so much confidence.']]), ('If I was a sculptor, heh, but then again, no
 Or a man who makes potions in a traveling show
 I know it’s not much, but it’s the best I can do', [['If he was a sculptor, he’d give his love a breathtaking sculpture. If he made potions, he’d give his love one. Sadly, he isn’t any of these and instead of fancy gifts (sculptures or potions) he gives his love a song.

Of course, as we now know, Bernie Taupin’s gift for writing songs, and Elton John’s gift for singing songs, have given them the money to buy pretty much anything they want.']]), ('But the sun’s been quite kind while I wrote this song
 It’s for people like you that keep it turned on', [['Fortunately, he has a pleasantly sunny day as he’s writing.

The person he’s writing about keeps the sun “turned on” for him — the sunshine in his life.']]), ('I don’t have much money, but, boy, if I did
 I’d buy a big house where we both could live', [['He isn’t the richest man out there, but if he were, then he would buy a big house for both of them.

Although this is supposedly Sir Elton John’s house now. It’s pretty big.']]), ('It’s a little bit funny, this feeling inside
 I’m not one of those who can easily hide', [['Falling in love gives you butterflies which is the “funny feeling inside” and Elton can’t hide his love like other people.

This line could also refer to John’s sexuality and how hiding his feelings towards men wasn’t something that he could easily do.']]), ('And you can tell everybody this is your song
 It may be quite simple, but now that it’s done
 I hope you don’t mind, I hope you don’t mind
 That I put down in words
 How wonderful life is while you’re in the world', [['Since the song is about his feelings, he wants that person that hes reaching out to tell everyone what hes done, but since its simple it doesn’t matter cause its done. And he hopes it doesn’t bother him or her if he just puts it in words but he glad that his life turned around since his love as been in the world with him.']])]

name: All of Me
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
What would I do without your smart mouth?
Drawin' me in and you kickin' me out
You've got my head spinnin', no kiddin'
I can't pin you down
What's goin' on in that beautiful mind?
I'm on your magical mystery ride
And I'm so dizzy, don't know what hit me
But I'll be alright

[Pre-Chorus]
My head's under water, but I'm breathing fine
You're crazy and I'm out of my mind

[Chorus]
'Cause all of me
Loves all of you
Love your curves and all your edges
All your perfect imperfections
Give your all to me
I'll give my all to you
You're my end and my beginnin'
Even when I lose, I'm winnin'

[Post-Chorus]
'Cause I give you all of me
And you give me all of you, oh-oh
[Verse 2]
How many times do I have to tell you?
Even when you're crying, you're beautiful too
The world is beating you down, I'm around
Through every mood
You're my downfall, you're my muse
My worst distraction, my rhythm and blues
I can't stop singing, it's ringing
In my head for you

[Pre-Chorus]
My head's under water, but I'm breathin' fine
You're crazy and I'm out of my mind

[Chorus]
'Cause all of me
Loves all of you
Love your curves and all your edges
All your perfect imperfections
Give your all to me
I'll give my all to you
You're my end and my beginnin'
Even when I lose, I'm winnin'

[Post-Chorus]
'Cause I give you all of me
And you give me all of you, oh-oh
[Bridge]
Give me all of you, oh
Cards on the table, we're both showing hearts
Risking it all, though it's hard

[Chorus]
'Cause all of me
Loves all of you
Love your curves and all your edges
All your perfect imperfections
Give your all to me
I'll give my all to you
You're my end and my beginnin'
Even when I lose, I'm winnin'

[Post-Chorus]
'Cause I give you all of me
And you give me all of you

[Outro]
I give you all of me
And you give me all of you, oh-oh
annotations:
[('My worst distraction, my rhythm and blues
 I can’t stop singing, it’s ringing
 In my head for you', [['Sheds fresh light on the line above. She’s his “downfall” as an artist because she’s his “worst distraction,” but she’s also the subject of his best art: his “rhythm and blues.” Even as thoughts of her are “ringing in [his] head”–like a distracting alarm bell? an earworm?–he “can’t stop singing,” can’t stop pouring out his soul in art.

The theme of having someone stuck in your head, like a catchy song, has itself generated a lot of catchy songs over the years:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CnXyBHsMz2U

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDhMkHfTdTc

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YPwtJ89jes4']]), ('You’re my downfall, you’re my muse', [['In this line Legend draws on two of the oldest archetypes in literature: the femme fatale and the muse.

The femme fatale (literally, “fatal woman”) is a dangerous, often mysterious seductress-figure who tempts lovers to their doom. Muses were originally goddesses of inspiration in Greek mythology; later the term began to be applied to human figures (lovers or would-be lovers) whose attractiveness inspires artists.

By linking his love with these two legendary (get it?) character types, Legend paints a contradiction: the woman he’s “out of [his] mind” for sometimes brings him crashing down, sometimes propels him to new heights.



Gustave Moreau, Hesiod and the Muse (1891)']]), ('I give you all of me
 And you give me all of you, oh-oh', [['Once again, Legend highlights that his love for this girl is sincere and will never change. There’s a strong connection here to wedding vows, including modern-day takes on the famous vows from the Book of Common Prayer. See for example:

I vow to love you through sickness and health,
through the good and the bad,
through richer and poorer.
You are everything I need,
and at this moment
I know that all my prayers have been answered
and that all of my dreams have come true.
This is the moment I have waited my whole life for.
I promise to give you my all
and I know that I could not ask for more from you.']]), ('How many times do I have to tell you?
 Even when you’re crying, you’re beautiful too
 The world is beating you down, I’m around
 Through every mood', [['During an interview with Elle Magazine Legend commented on singing the song to his then girlfriend and now wife Chrissy Teigen:

Well, I played it for her as soon as I wrote it back in 2011, it was pretty early in the project. It’s one of the older songs on the album as far as when I wrote them. I just sang it for her acapella, and she loved it. She cried.

He further revealed to Glamour magazine that he sung it to her at their wedding.']]), ('I’m on your magical mystery ride', [['An allusion to the classic Beatles album. Legend is enraptured by the magical heights his girl can take him to. Hopefully Legend will have much more love in the future.']]), ('And I’m so dizzy, don’t know what hit me
 But I’ll be alright', [['He is dizzied by his newfound happiness, shell-shocked by the passionate feelings involved, and maybe unsure of whether or not he deserves this bliss.

At the time he wrote this song, the depth of Legend’s love for his wife was brand new to him, as he stated in a 2013 interview with Hello Beautiful:

I haven’t been through a really hard breakup because before Chrissy, I had never been with anyone longer than six-nine months. I never had a long relationship I had to recover from. They were all not so serious before. If Chrissy and I broke up, that would be tough because we’ve been together for quite a long time and I wouldn’t exactly know how to get over that.']]), ('My head’s under water, but I’m breathing fine
 You’re crazy and I’m out of my mind', [['Love can feel overwhelming, like swimming in powerful ocean currents. Legend’s just fine with that: he’s breathing in the “Sea of Love” as if it were his natural element.

Their love may make them seem crazy to outsiders, but they’re in this thing together and wouldn’t have it any other way.']]), ('What would I do without your smart mouth?
 Drawin’ me in and you kickin’ me out
 You’ve got my head spinnin’, no kiddin’
 I can’t pin you down
 What’s goin’ on in that beautiful mind?', [['This woman (presumably Legend’s wife Chrissy Teigen) speaks to him with a particular tone. Her sarcastic demeanour is something he’s grown to love.

He’s describing the interpersonal dynamic and uncertain state of mind resulting from falling in love with a Cluster B personality, such as a histrionic, borderline, or narcissistic personality.']]), ('Give your all to me
 I’ll give my all to you
 You’re my end and my beginnin’
 Even when I lose, I’m winnin’', [['Executive producer Dave Tozer described the song to Sonic Scoop as:

A stirring interplay of Legend’s vocals and piano, it’s a strong love song filled with awe. Engrossing and gorgeous, this track may very well endure for years to come.

Their love is so pure it sees no flaws. He loves her for who she is and not what he would want her to be. She is it for him, he found his half to complete him. He can be vulnerable with her and her with him and together, nothing can hold them down, and they give each other all of themselves because in the end it’s all they know to be true because they have undying, true and sincere love for each other.

Prior to finding Teigen, Legend looked forever for his one true love. However, she has put an end to that because she is his love. Now his life can begin.']]), ('Cards on the table, we’re both showing hearts
 Risking it all, though it’s hard', [['Putting your cards on the table is a metaphor for putting yourself out there without knowing  what the outcome will be. In most card games it’s a serious disadvantage because the people you’re playing with will know your moves.

In this case Legend and his lady love have the same hand: they’re both “showing hearts,” both madly in love with each other.

“Risking it all” suggests that this is probably a poker metaphor. (But wait–could Legend and his love both be trying to “shoot the moon” in the card game Hearts? If so: HUGE risk! They could both lose big-time.)']])]

name: Beyond
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Don't wanna get ahead of myself
Feeling things I've never felt
It's kinda hard for me to explain
Her personality and everything
Brings me to my knees, ooh
She shines me up like gold on my arm
I wanna take it slow but it's so hard
I love to see her face in daylight
It's more than just our bodies at night
But she's really tempting me, ooh
Do you think I'm being foolish if I don't rush in?

[Chorus]
I'm scared to death that she might be it
That the love is real, that the shoe might fit
She might just be my everything and beyond (beyond)
Space and time in the afterlife
Will she have my kids? Will she be my wife?
She might just be my everything and beyond

[Verse 2]
I wanna bring her 'round to meet ya
I think you'd like her kind demeanor
I know that Grandma would've loved her, like she was her own
She makes me feel at home, ooh
Do you think I'm being foolish if I don't rush in?
[Chorus]
I'm scared to death that she might be it
That the love is real, that the shoe might fit
She might just be my everything and beyond (beyond)
Space and time in the afterlife
Will she have my kids? Will she be my wife?
She might just be my everything and beyond

[Bridge]
I give up, I'm in love crying out to you
O me o my I can't explain
She might just be my everything
O me o my I can't explain (Oohhh)
She might just be my everything
O me o my I can't explain
She might just be my everything (my everything)
So do you think I'm being foolish if I don't rush in?

[Chorus]
I'm scared to death that she might be it
That the love is real, that the shoe might fit
She might just be my everything and beyond (beyond)
Space and time in the afterlife
Will she have my kids? Will she be my wife?
She might just be my everything and beyond
[Outro]
(She might just be mine)
O me o my I can't explain
(She might just be mine)
She might just be my everything
(She might just be mine)
O me o my I can't explain
(She might just be mine)
She might just be my everything
(She might just be mine)
O me o my I can't explain
(She might just be mine)
She might just be my everything
She might just be mine, be mine
annotations:
[('I give up, I’m in love crying out to you
 O me o my I can’t explain
 She might just be my everything', [['That lyric is basically surrendering to love. For me, it’s definitely something that I haven’t done yet but in the future when I guess I’m done with running around, then I’ll be ready to surrender.']]), ('I know that Grandma would’ve loved her, like she was her own', [['That speaks about my grandmother Urtha Sawyer who passed away and so, that’s where that comes from. You know it’s like, “Mom, this girl is super dope "and you know if, basically saying that if Urtha was still here, she’d give her the right of passage. My grandmother, I never met her but yeah she was very strict, religious woman. And so, I think for her, for anyone to date my mother, you have to be a man of God.']]), ('I wanna bring her ’round to meet ya
 I think you’d like her kind demeanor', [['The whole song it’s me having a conversation with my mother, The perspective on this song is me having a conversation with my mother about this girl that I’m feeling.']]), ('She might just be my everything and beyond (beyond)', [['“Everything and beyond” is that stage of marriage and living a happy life and hopefully some kids.']]), ('Do you think I’m being foolish if I don’t rush in?', [['The times that we’ve hung out, we’ve never been sexually intimate, and that’s kind of like a decision that I wanted to make because as soon as you get involved in that way, it really takes things to a different level. It’s fun playing the field, but this particular woman I want to save that for when we’re married. You know? Not to come off like no hero. But this gal, you know what I’m saying?']]), ('She shines me up like gold on my arm', [['That’s her making me a better person. I want to be with somebody that sharpens me, you know, that helps me grow. I want to be able to always learn from her and vice versa.']]), ('It’s kinda hard for me to explain
 Her personality and everything
 Brings me to my knees, ooh', [['For myself, it’s hard just in general for me to articulate what I’m feeling. And sometimes there aren’t words to describe it. You know, it kind of just is. It’s kind of the same thing when it comes to when I write a song. The meaning is up here, but explaining that to somebody else is like “oh, I don’t really know.” Because it’s in the lyrics.']]), ('Don’t wanna get ahead of myself
 Feeling things I’ve never felt', [['Whenever I want to pursue a gal it’s like, it’s going to be the one that I want to be with forever instead of wasting time. This particular woman is the one that really stuck out to me and I’ve never had anybody ever tell me that they love me and of course it was hard for me to tell her that I loved her back. You know, once again I didn’t want to jump the gun on it.']])]

name: Thinking out Loud
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
When your legs don't work like they used to before
And I can't sweep you off of your feet
Will your mouth still remember the taste of my love?
Will your eyes still smile from your cheeks?
And darling, I will be loving you till we're seventy
And baby, my heart could still fall as hard at twenty-three
And I'm thinking 'bout how

[Pre-Chorus 1]
People fall in love in mysterious ways
Maybe just the touch of a hand
Well me, I fall in love with you every single day
I just wanna tell you I am

[Chorus]
So honey, now, take me into your loving arms
Kiss me under the light of a thousand stars
Place your head on my beating heart, I'm thinking out loud
And maybe we found love right where we are

[Verse 2]
When my hair's all but gone and my memory fades
And the crowds don't remember my name
When my hands don't play the strings the same way
I know you will still love me the same
'Cause, honey, your soul could never grow old, it's evergreen
And baby, your smile's forever in my mind and memory
And I'm thinking 'bout how
[Pre-Chorus 2]
People fall in love in mysterious ways
And maybe it's all part of a plan
Well I'll just keep on making the same mistakes
Hoping that you'll understand
[Chorus]
That, baby, now, take me into your loving arms
Kiss me under the light of a thousand stars
Place your head on my beating heart, I'm thinking out loud
And maybe we found love right where we are
[Chorus]
So baby, now, take me into your loving arms
Kiss me under the light of a thousand stars
Oh darling, place your head on my beating heart, I'm thinking out loud
That maybe we found love right where we are
Oh baby, we found love right where we are
And we found love right where we are
annotations:
[('Well I’ll just keep on making the same mistakes
 Hoping that you’ll understand', [['Ed isn’t alone. Psychology Today reports that we’re most likely to repeat mistakes when stressed (perhaps by a new relationship!):

Under stress, we tend to retreat to habits of emotion regulation formed in toddlerhood. Habits rule under stress and when the regulatory processes of the prefrontal cortex (the Adult brain) are overtaxed from physical or mental exhaustion.']]), ('People fall in love in mysterious ways
 Maybe just the touch of a hand
 Well me, I fall in love with you every single day
 I just wanna tell you I am', [['U2 famously sang about a woman who moved in “Mysterious Ways.” Sheeran sees that mystery in all relationships, and feels it in his own on a daily basis. Each day, he actively finds something else in her that makes him fall in love.']]), ('And I’m thinking ’bout how', [['Ed isn’t kidding here. Psychological studies have pinpointed 20 reasons people fall in love, and most of them are pretty mysterious. These include keeping your hand and torso open when you talk, offering your date hot drinks instead of cold drinks, and walking at the same pace as they do.

These seemingly random causes for love prove Ed’s point: if two people are meant to be together their love will be triggered one way or another.']]), ('When my hair’s all but gone and my memory fades
 And the crowds don’t remember my name
 When my hands don’t play the strings the same way
 I know you will still love me the same', [['In this verse, Ed reveals his fears extends beyond simply getting old. He’s also worried that he may lose his appeal when his fame starts to fade.

But as he explores those fears in this verse, his confidence seems to grow. Instead of asking his love questions, he begins to describe their future with assurance.



Ed’s grandfather suffered from Alzheimer’s disease as he mentioned on “Afire Love”, making him especially nervous about the toll old age can take on your body and memory.']]), ('And darling, I will be loving you till we’re seventy
 And baby, my heart could still fall as hard at twenty-three
 And I’m thinking ’bout how', [["Ed’s desire to grow old with a partner is inspired by his parents' love. As he told UK publication Mirror,

My parents are so in love it’s ridiculous. I kind of look at it like pressure. They’ve cracked it and my grandparents cracked it – but nowadays it’s harder to find that. I hope to have kids.



Ed with his mother, brother, and father

Ed only says he’ll love her “til we’re seventy” because seventy rhymes with twenty-three – he’s not actually going to call off the marriage on her 70th birthday! (we hope)"]]), ('So honey, now, take me into your loving arms
 Kiss me under the light of a thousand stars
 Place your head on my beating heart, I’m thinking out loud', [['Ed often uses the stars as a symbol for romance, naming another cut from x “All of the Stars”, which appeared on the soundtrack for The Fault In Our Stars.



Ed’s desire for a night with a thousand stars in the sky recalls an old Jimi Hendrix line.']]), ('And maybe we found love right where we are', [['This line is strongly associated with this song, but Ed has used the lyrics “we found love” before. On “Sing,” the first single from x, they had to go to a rave to find romance; here Sheeran celebrates a more mundane but also more sustaining love.

Musically, this has a strong resemblance to Van Morrison’s “Crazy Love”
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oeE7BOLB8Jc#t=0m33s

When music journalist Mark Kemp noted a “Van Morrison-like vibe,” Sheeran enthusiastically agreed.

“That’s exactly what I wanted to capture,” he says. “I feel like everyone channels Jack Johnson, everyone channels Prince, everyone channels the Beatles, and there’s not really anyone in popular culture now that has gone and channeled a bit of Van.”']]), ('’Cause, honey, your soul could never grow old, it’s evergreen
 And baby, your smile’s forever in my mind and memory', [['In case you couldn’t tell by the name, evergreen trees don’t turn brown and decrepit in the winter. Ed’s love for this girl and memory of her features won’t fade over time, it will remain as vivid as the color on an evergreen.

Ed also dwells on his love for the tree in the January 2011 song, “Nightmare”:

Right now it’s better than it’s ever been
Never fade like a plant that’s evergreen']])]

annotations:
[('Stand by me', [['Fun fact: this song is featured in a movie of the same title, based on a novella by Stephen King.']]), ('[Intro]', [["The intro starts with the song’s signature bass pattern. It’s importance is underlined by co-writer Mike Stoller:

Jerry [Wexler, an Atlantic Records producer] always said that bassline made the song. And it’s true that, whenever the record starts, or a band plays it at a wedding, you know what’s coming just through those first bars. source

This iconic rhythm has appeared in many other pop songs, such as the Zombies' “Time Of The Season”."]]), ('Oh, stand by me', [['Other songs that come to mind:

Tammy Wynette’s Stand by Your Man

Stand by your man
And show the world you love him
Keep giving all the love you can

and

The Clash’s Train in Vain bemoaning the singer’s pain when his beloved did not stand by him at all!

You said you loved me and that’s a fact
And then you left me said you felt trapped
Well, some things you can explain away
But the heartache’s with me till this day
You didn’t stand by me
No, not at all
You didn’t stand by me
No way']]), ('Whenever you’re in trouble won’t you stand by me', [['Ten years later, another classic song with a similar theme and lyrics that remind of this great song hit the scene – Carole King’s (via James Taylor) [“You’ve Got a Friend” –

When you’re down and troubled
And you need some loving care']]), ('Oh, stand by me
 Woah, just stand now
 Oh, stand, stand by me', [['The phrase To stand by usually means “help me”, “support me"loyal” to me“.

Here, the use takes a hundred and eighty degree turn. The lyricist provides the comfort and safety, rather than requesting some.

Still, the underlying message is perhaps the mutuality in the act – by helping others, one helps himself, as h"detailed" in the first verse.']]), ('When the night has come
 And the land is dark
 And the moon is the only light we’ll see', [['This sets the mood for the song, explaining that there could be literal darkness or that this girl is going through a time where it seems she’s shrouded in mental darkness, moonlight will be the only thing shining through.']]), ('If the sky that we look upon
 Should tumble and fall
 Or the mountains should crumble to the sea
 I won’t cry, I won’t cry
 No, I won’t shed a tear
 Just as long as you stand, stand by me', [['Even physical desolation (“mountains should crumble”) shan’t eclipse the profound love and affection King feels for this woman. So long as she remains by him he won’t be susceptible or vulnerable.

This line can also be interpreted with religious connotation, as it references the Bible’s book of Psalms, specifically Chapter 46, verse 2:

Therefore will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and though the mountains be carried into the midst of the sea;

In this light, the singer’s fervent devotion to his subject reflects the love of holy worship. Some could even argue the song is more religious than romantic.

The phrase “the sky that we look upon”, has the accent on the “on” of upon, and the line has become a rock classic.  In actuality we look up on to the sky, because to look upon, we’d have to either be considering the sky in an abstract manner or we’d have to be looking down from a position on high – a position where from this day forward, Mr. Ben E. King may very well have a good view.']])]

annotations: [('And the chains of Amistad couldn’t hold us', [['The Amistad was a schooner owned by a Cuban Spainard, and sometimes carried slaves who were likely chained to prevent escape. The Amistad became famous after being the subject of a successful slave revolt in 1839, where captured African slaves successfully took control of the ship.\n\nThe Amistad later ended up in the United States, where the Supreme Court ruled that the captives on the boat were legally free because the US had banned the African slave trade. Thus, the captives  broke past their chains towards freedom despite it seeming impossible to do so. Whitney’s comparing their love to the success of the Amistad slave revolt: it’ll break past any barriers that hold it down.']]), ('(Sing mommy)', [['Guest vocal from none other than Whitney’s own daughter Bobbi Kristina Brown. Bobbi was five at the time. When her mom brought her into the studio and held her up to the mic, she said “Sing mommy,” which Whitney loved so much she had producers Wonda Duplessis and Wyclef Jean leave it in.']])]

Beyonce is saying that her lover has saved her and made her life indescribably better.']]), ('Everywhere I’m lookin’ now
 I’m surrounded by your embrace', [['The lyrics describe the love interest as a guardian angel that watches over the speaker, despite the fact that it wasn’t clear at first that the ‘angel’ had their best interests in mind. Now, the speaker hopes that their love will last forever.

Many of the songs throughout the album I Am… follow a similar theme, and can be attributed to Beyoncé’s marriage to Jay-Z that year. Despite their rocky relationship, she can now see through all of his past and see that he is her heaven-sent partner.']]), ('You know you’re my savin’ grace
 You’re everything I need and more', [['The reference to saving grace extends the metaphor of a divine nature that defines the subject of this song. It emphasizes the fact that Beyonce views this person as a savior that brought her to a better place rather than letting her continue down a path of destruction.']]), ('Gravity can’t begin
 To pull me back to the ground again', [['To have your head in the clouds is too be too absorbed in your thoughts. This saying is particularly associated with daydreaming after one has first fallen in love. In this instance, “gravity can’t begin to pull me back to the ground again”, the realities of life cannot pull them apart or diminish her love for him. No matter what has happened, they go through it and do not fall apart. She continues to be that happy love no matter what.']]), ('Hit me like a ray of sun
 Burnin’ through my darkest night', [['When Beyonce is feeling down, and she feels like its a dark night, the person she is explaining always comes to her mind and helps her.']]), ('Standin’ in the light of your halo
 I got my angel now', [['Angels are often considered to be guardians, suggesting this man is more than a normal guy; he appears divine and approaches her with infinite love.

What she loves the most about him (the halo) isn’t something he does, but rather an extension of who he is.']]), ('Remember those walls I built?
 Well, baby, they’re tumblin’ down
 And they didn’t even put up a fight
 They didn’t even make a sound
 I found a way to let you in
 But I never really had a doubt', [['People build metaphorical walls around their heart to keeping their guard up in a relationship, fending off love interests that may eventually be hurtful. These walls, usually erected after a bad heartbreak, make it difficult to trust new people.

But Beyoncé is letting her guard down and letting him in. Her walls dropped without struggle, indicating that releasing herself from her emotional bondage was the right choice.']])]

name: Kiss from a Rose
lyrics:
[Click to see Seal explain how he wrote "Kiss From A Rose"]

[Hook]
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya

[Verse 1]
There used to be a greying tower alone on the sea
You became the light on the dark side of me
Love remained a drug that's the high and not the pill

[Pre-Chorus]
But did you know that when it snows
My eyes become large and
The light that you shine can't be seen?

[Chorus]
Baby, I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grey
Ooh, the more I get of you, the stranger it feels, yeah
And now that your rose is in bloom
A light hits the gloom on the grey

[Hook]
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya
[Verse 2]
There is so much a man can tell you
So much he can say
You remain my power, my pleasure, my pain, baby
To me you're like a growing addiction that I can't deny
Won't you tell me is that healthy, baby?

[Pre-Chorus]
But did you know that when it snows
My eyes become large and
The light that you shine can't be seen?

[Chorus]
Baby, I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grey
Ooh, the more I get of you, the stranger it feels, yeah
And now that your rose is in bloom
A light hits the gloom on the grey

[Bridge]
I've been kissed by a rose on the grey
I, I've been kissed by a rose on the grey
I've ... (and if I should fall along the way) ... been kissed by a rose on the grey
I, I've been kissed by a rose on the grey

[Verse 2]
There is so much a man can tell you
So much he can say
You remain my power, my pleasure, my pain
To me you're like a growing addiction that I can't deny, yeah
Won't you tell me is that healthy, baby?
[Pre-Chorus]
But did you know that when it snows
My eyes become large and
The light that you shine can't be seen?

[Chorus]
Baby, I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grey
Ooh, the more I get of you, the stranger it feels, yeah
And now that your rose is in bloom
A light hits the gloom on the grey
Yes, I compare you to a kiss from a rose on the grey
Ooh, the more I get of you, the stranger it feels, yeah
And now that your rose is in bloom
A light hits the gloom on the grey

[Hook]
Ba-ya-ya, ba-da-da-da-da-da, ba-ya-ya

[Outro]
Now that your rose is in bloom
A light hits the gloom on the grey
annotations:
[('But did you know that when it snows
 My eyes become large and', [['When it snows, a metaphor for his darker inner state, he gets too mellowed by his sorrow that he cannot see even her positivity and help. He regards himself as helpless, reaffirming his need for her help and warmth.']]), ('But did you know that when it snows
 My eyes become large and', [['This could be a reference to cocaine or general distraction. Meaning when there’s a barrier, (or when using), he tries harder to ‘see’ because he’s paranoid/more needy.']]), ('There used to be a greying tower alone on the sea
 You became the light on the dark side of me', [['Seal may be describing his own life as a lighthouse. The dark side is the ocean, a vast expanse of turbulence and the unknown. Before meeting this woman, this “light”, he was basically useless, as a lighthouse without light isn’t very practical. She lights the way for him and helps him navigate tricky situations (like a pitch black ocean).']]), ('[Verse 1]', [['I have avoided explaining these lyrics for over 25 years. I am not going to start doing it now.']]), ('[Click to see Seal explain how he wrote ”Kiss From A Rose”]', [['I wrote this song 28 years ago now. I wrote it way before I wrote any of my first album. I wrote it about three years before I was even signed, before I had a deal. It is really old.

The song started off as an experiment. When I was just starting out, I was living in a squat. I had one of those four-tracks port-a-studios, basically a tape machine that takes a cassette and splits it up into four tracks.

I threw the tape in the corner. I was embarrassed by it so I wouldn’t play it for my producer, Trevor Horn. But I played it to a friend. So then, when I was recording my second album, Trevor kept asking me about this “rose” song he’d heard about. My friend had told him about it. I finally played it to him on the second album, because he kept brow beating me into it.

To be honest, I was never really that proud of it, though I like what Trevor did with the recording. He turned that tape from my corner into another 8 million record sales and my name became a household name.

I realized it just wasn’t a song from a tape in the corner when I was picking up Grammys for it. Of course I love it now and I am just so appreciative of the fact that I have a song like that, that most people love.']]), ('There is so much a man can tell you
 So much he can say', [['Taken as “There is (only) so much a man can tell you…”

Men, and their egos, frequently suppress their emotions and refuse to share their true feelings.']]), ('Ooh, the more I get of you, the stranger it feels, yeah', [['This obvious reference to the basic nature of cocaine use continues the “duality theme” between literal addiction and a codependent relationship.']]), ('The light that you shine can’t be seen?', [['Listen closely.

It makes sense – If it snows, perhaps meaning some distraction or obstruction of sight – then her worth becomes invisible to him because he’s not able to appreciate it or pay attention.  In other words, he’s not sensitive enough to savor her light or love.

Continuing the theme of drug abuse, “snow” is an alternative name for cocaine or other white powdered drugs. Drugs can open the mind, and cocaine is known to dilate pupils. They also tend to make lights brighter.']]), ('And now that your rose is in bloom
 A light hits the gloom on the grey', [['More romantic imagery of the rose blooming in a sudden beam of light against the gray tower. The author has become fused with the idea that she is the only thing that improves his life and gives him confidence.']]), ('Love remained a drug that’s the high and not the pill', [['Here he indicates that love is equivalent or higher than any pill or man made substance. This is a sharp shifts from the romantic imagery of a lighthouse by the sea, and establishes a theme of duality between substance abuse and an unhealthy relationship.']])]

name: I'll Stand by You
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Oh, why you look so sad?
Tears are in your eyes
Come on and come to me now
Don't be ashamed to cry
Let me see you through
'Cause I've seen the dark side too

[Verse 2]
When the night falls on you
You don't know what to do
Nothing you confess
Could make me love you less

[Chorus 1]
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you

[Verse 3]
So if you're mad, get mad
Don't hold it all inside
Come on and talk to me now
Hey, what you got to hide?
I get angry too
Well, I'm a lot like you
[Verse 4]
When you're standing at the crossroads
And don't know which path to choose
Let me come along
'Cause even if you're wrong

[Chorus 2]
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you
Take me in, into your darkest hour
And I'll never desert you
I'll stand by you

[Guitar Solo]

[Bridge]
And when, when the night falls on you, baby
You're feeling all alone
You won't be on your own

[Outro]
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you
Take me in, into your darkest hour
And I'll never desert you
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you, yeah
(Won't let nobody hurt you)
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you
Baby, into your darkest hour
And I'll never desert you
I'll stand by you
I'll stand by you
Won't let nobody hurt you
I'll stand by you
annotations: [('Nothing you confess\n Could make me love you less', [['No Matter What This Person Does, And Tells Chrissie About It, She Will Still Love Them The Same']])]

name: Chasing Cars
lyrics:
[Intro]

[Verse 1]
We'll do it all
Everything
On our own
We don't need
Anything or anyone

[Chorus]
If I lay here
If I just lay here
Would you lie with me and just forget the world?

[Verse 2]
I don't quite know
How to say
How I feel
Those three words
Are said too much
They're not enough

[Chorus]
If I lay here
If I just lay here
Would you lie with me and just forget the world?
Forget what we're told
Before we get too old
Show me a garden that's burstin' into life
[Verse 3]
Let's waste time
Chasing cars
Around our heads
I need your grace
To remind me
To find my own

[Chorus]
If I lay here
If I just lay here
Would you lie with me and just forget the world?
Forget what we're told
Before we get too old
Show me a garden that's burstin' into life

[Bridge]
All that I am
All that I ever was
Is here in your perfect eyes, they're all I can see
I don't know where
Confused about how, as well
Just know that these things will never change for us at all

[Chorus]
If I lay here
If I just lay here
Would you lie with me and just forget the world?
[Outro]
annotations:
[('I don’t know where
 Confused about how, as well
 Just know that these things will never change for us at all', [['Gary has no idea where their relationship will take them, nor how it’s going to happen, but he wants his other half to know that their love will last forever, no matter what.']]), ('All that I am
 All that I ever was
 Is here in your perfect eyes, they’re all I can see', [['As mentioned above, it was “Chasing Cars”‘ appearance in Grey’s Anatomy which catapulted Snow Patrol to Stateside fame. Seattle Times journalist Richard Harrington wrote that these lines, in particular, made such a feat seem almost premeditated.

[…] sung against the backdrop of one major character dying and another reviving, as well as a romantic relationship imploding — sounded almost customized. Alexandra Patsavas, the show’s music supervisor, called it “a beautiful and complex song [that] served as the perfect soundtrack to a series of very complex moments.']]), ('Forget what we’re told
 Before we get too old
 Show me a garden that’s burstin’ into life', [['Here they beg the other to forget the stereotypes of the world they know, instead choosing to believe in this new vision with them. They ask them to look for this proof of life, of something beyond what they know.']]), ('If I lay here
 If I just lay here
 Would you lie with me and just forget the world?', [['This lyric seems to beg the question, if one simply stops, what will they see as time passes them by? The singer asks if they take this break, will their partner stay with them? And agree to look at their lives with new eyes?']]), ('Let’s waste time
 Chasing cars
 Around our heads', [['It’s about being infatuated with someone. ‘Chasing Cars’ is a reference to being like a dog chasing a car – it’s a pointless exercise but they do it anyway and what would they do with the car once they caught it?

The line came from Gary Lightbody’s father when he told him he was like a dog chasing a car when he was obsessed over a girl.

When you’re infatuated with someone, you can ‘waste’ endless hours together just being with each other – not necessarily achieving anything except being in your own little world together.']]), ('I don’t quite know
 How to say
 How I feel
 Those three words
 Are said too much
 They’re not enough', [['He’s having trouble expressing his feelings for her. ‘I love you’ is so commonly said that he thinks she deserves more, though words can’t do it justice.']])]

name: My Girl
lyrics:
[Instrumental Intro]
[Verse 1]
I've got sunshine on a cloudy day
When it's cold outside, I've got the month of May
I guess you'd say
What can make me feel this way?

[Chorus]
My girl, my girl, my girl
Talkin' 'bout my girl, my girl

[Verse 2]
I've got so much honey, the bees envy me
I've got a sweeter song than the birds in the trees
Well, I guess you'd say
What can make me feel this way?

[Chorus]
My girl, my girl, my girl
Talkin' 'bout my girl, my girl

[Bridge]
Ooh, ooh
Hey, hey, hey
Ooh, ooh
Hey, hey, hey
Ooh, ooh, yeah
[Verse 3]
I don't need no money, fortune, or fame
I've got all the riches, baby, one man can claim
Well, I guess you'd say
What can make me feel this way?

[Chorus]
My girl, my girl, my girl
Talkin' 'bout my girl, my girl
(Talkin' 'bout my girl)

[Outro]
I've got sunshine on a cloudy day (Woah, woah)
With my girl
I've even got the month of May
With my girl
Talkin' 'bout my girl
annotations:
[('I’ve got sunshine on a cloudy day', [['Antithesis would be what this part of the lyrics are about. By having sunshine on a cloudy day, the opposing ideas put together are examples that help the listener see how important and contrasting the artist’s ideas are.']]), ('I’ve got sunshine on a cloudy day
 When it’s cold outside, I’ve got the month of May', [['Ruffin is experiencing a sunny day, even though there’s nothing but clouds in the sky.



In May, the weather starts to get warmer. Despite it being cold outside, he’s feeling warm.

In other words, he’s expressing how it feels to be in love – he’s happy and has a warm feeling inside.']]), ('I’ve got all the riches, baby, one man can claim', [['Ruffin doesn’t need money, fortune, or fame to be rich because his girl is worth more than that and she’s all he needs.']]), ('[Outro]', [['The ad-libbed vocal outro, restating some of the song’s prior lyrics, was yet another Motown staple']]), ('[Verse 3]', [['Going into this verse, the song changes key, rising from C to D']]), ('[Verse 1]', [['This was the first Tempts song to feature David Ruffin singing lead, something that was actually Smokey’s idea:


 Eddie Kendricks sang lead on a number of the group’s early hits. But Smokey Robinson sensed that if he wrote a song, the right song, for heartthrob David Ruffin, he’d be launching a new star.

 “David Ruffin, I knew, was like this sleeping giant in this group because he had this—it’s sort of like a mellow gruff-sounding voice. And all I needed was the right song for his voice and I felt like I would have a smash hit record. So I sat down at the piano to write a song for David Ruffin’s voice. So I wanted to make it something that he could belt out, but yet make it melodic and sweet.”']]), ('[Instrumental Intro]', [['Motown was famous for their instrumental introductions to songs.  Even given that, this combo of bass, guitar, and fingersnaps is a star amongst stars

The 2002 film Standing in the Shadows of Motown had a heartbreaking scene where guitarist Robert White talked about hearing “My Girl” in a restaurant and wanting to be able to say, “I wrote that,” but realizing that the anonymity of Motown’s amazing house band, The Funk Brothers ensured that no one would believe him']])]

name: Turn Me On
lyrics:
Like a flower waiting to bloom
Like a lightbulb in a dark room
I'm just sitting here waiting for you
To come on home and turn me on

Like the desert waiting for the rain
Like a schoolkid waiting for the spring
I'm just sitting here waiting for you
To come on home and turn me on

And my poor heart, it's been so dark
Since you've been gone
After all, you're the one who turns me off
But you're the only one who can turn me back on

My hi-fi is waiting for a new tune
My glass is waiting for some fresh ice cubes
I'm just sitting here waiting for you
To come on home and turn me on
Turn me on

name: Wonderful Tonight
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
It's late in the evening, she's wondering what clothes to wear
She puts on her make-up and brushes her long blonde hair
And then she asks me, "Do I look all right?"
And I say, "Yes, you look wonderful tonight"

[Verse 2]
We go to a party and everyone turns to see
This beautiful lady that's walking around with me
And then she asks me "Do you feel all right?"
And I say, "Yes, I feel wonderful tonight"

[Bridge]
I feel wonderful because I see
The love light in your eyes
And the wonder of it all
Is that you just don't realize how much I love you

[Verse 3]
It's time to go home now and I've got an aching head
So I give her the car keys and she helps me to bed
And then I tell her, as I turn out the light
I say, "My darling, you were wonderful tonight
Oh my darling, you were wonderful tonight"
annotations: [('And I say, “Yes, you look wonderful tonight”', [['The meaning of the refrain changes with each verse. In the first verse, he’s a little impatient with his wife for taking so long to get ready–he assures her that she looks wonderful.\n\nIn the second verse, he’s amazed to be with such a beautiful woman, and he’s also enjoying everyone admiring her–he feels “wonderful tonight”. And in the last verse, a bit drunk and maudlin, he keeps repeating how wonderful she was at the party.']])]

annotations:
[('So confused

name: I Don't Want to Miss a Thing - From "Armageddon" Soundtrack

lyrics:

My darling
I've hungered for your touch

And time goes by so slowly
And time can do so much

I need your love
I need your love

[Verse]
Lonely rivers flow to the sea, to the sea
To the open arms of the sea
Lonely rivers sigh, "Wait for me, wait for me
I'll be coming home, wait for me"

[Chorus]
Whoa, my love
My darling

annotations:
[('Lonely rivers flow to the sea, to the sea
 To the open arms of the sea
 Lonely rivers sigh, ”Wait for me, wait for me
 I’ll be coming home, wait for me”', [['The metaphor in this is that his “rivers of loneliness” will someday lead to something bigger. As it is inevitable that a river will at some point meet a sea, Zaret is implying that his loneliness will eventually lead to love. In addition to this, by using the river to sea metaphor, he is also implying that the end of loneliness through love is natural and they just the way things should be. (Not unlike a line from another famous ballad that came out a few years later.)']])]

Time after time
Time after time
Time after time
Time after time
Time after time

annotations:
[('Suitcase of memories
 Time after—', [['“Suitcase of memories” was one of the first lines written for the song, penned by co-writer Rob Hyman of The Hooters. Cyndi was struck by it and said it was a “wonderful line”.

Coincidentally, both were having relationship problems at the time of writing this song, with Rob just going through a breakup and Cyndi having troubles with her then-boyfriend and manager.']]), ('If you’re lost, you can look and you will find me
 Time after time
 If you fall, I will catch you, I’ll be waiting
 Time after time', [['Rob Hyman recalled recording the backing vocals on the chorus:

I added my voice just as a reference for another singer, a male-female dialogue thing, as if they’re singing to each other. When Cyndi listened back, she liked it and said, “We’re keeping it.”']]), ('The drum beats out of time', [['This could be about how sometimes the only reason relationships never happened or relationships don’t work out is because the timing is just not right. One person has just gotten out of a serious relationship, or one person is already in a relationship, or they are pursuing their own goals, etc. The drum could also symbolize their heartbeats, which aren’t quite synchronized together.']]), ('Sometimes, you picture me
 I’m walking too far ahead', [['This line could go along with the “go slow” line. He thinks she is taking things too fast. In his head, she is walking much too far ahead of him in the relationship. He isn’t ready to go that far yet, perhaps physically or emotionally.

It also could be about a guy who longs for her. He really wants to be with her, but she is always just out of reach. “The drum beats out of time,” and it’s never the right time for them to be together. Whenever he tries to picture being with her, she is just too far away, always right out of his reach.']]), ('You said, “Go slow.”
 I fall behind', [['Sometimes when someone tells  you to go slow in a relationship, your blossoming feelings may atrophy and eventually fade completely and you ‘fall behind’.

On the other end, your feelings could already be strong and you are asked to go slow so you feel like your feelings aren’t reciprocated so you stop trying with the relationship and ‘fall behind’

In this song, I think Cyndi is going for the second meaning.']]), ('Secrets stolen from deep inside', [['Everyone has deep personal feelings they do not allow the world to see or hear.  This line expresses exposing one of those feelings to someone you care for after they kept digging at you to tell them, and you do because of love, fear, or even guilt.  They stole you inner most feelings from you.']]), ('Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time
 Time after time', [['Lauper explained to the Wall Street Journal:

My repeating “time after time” as a fading whisper at the end just happened. I had fallen into a trance and came out of it like that, singing softly. I wanted it to sound hushed, like my voice was trailing off into the distance.']]), ('If you’re lost, you can look and you will find me
 Time after time
 If you fall, I will catch you, I’ll be waiting
 Time after time
 If you’re lost, you can look and you will find me
 Time after time
 If you fall, I will catch you, I’ll be waiting (I will be waiting)
 Time after time', [['Cyndi Lauper talked about writing this hook with Rob Hyman in an interview with the Wall Street Journal:


We started by putting together a list of song titles. I thumbed through a TV Guide magazine. One movie title seemed good—a sci-fi film called “Time After Time” from 1979. I never meant for it to be the song’s real title. It was just supposed to get me thinking…

While Rob [Hyman] played, I stood next to the piano and danced, kind of free form. Moving around like that to the music helped me figure out how the song should feel. I wanted to catch a vibe off what Rob was doing.

Rob had just the chorus—a good melody but no words. As I danced to what Rob played I started thinking about up and down, lost and found: “If you fall I will catch you, I will be waiting / Time after time” and “If you’re lost you can look and you will find me / Time after time.” It sounded odd at first, but when I sang it, I realized what I was talking about. They were pieces of my personal life.


At the time, Rob Hyman was coming off of a breakup while Lauper was having her own issues with her then-boyfriend/manager Dave Wolff.']]), ('You’re calling to me
 I can’t hear what you’ve said
 Then you say, “Go slow.”
 I fall behind
 The second hand unwinds', [['Cyndi Lauper talked to The Wall Street Journal about this line:

That was inspired by [producer] Rick [Chertoff]. At some point in the studio, his watch came in contact with something and it became demagnetized. Its second hand was going backward and he was saying, “Look, look, my second hand is unwinding.” I loved that line.']]), ('After my picture fades
 And darkness has turned to gray
 Watching through windows
 You’re wondering if I’m okay', [['Cyndi Lauper talked to The Wall Street Journal about this line:

[That] was about my past relationships. I used to sit up on that loft bed and look out the window and watch darkness turn to gray, thinking about them.']])]

name: Say You Won't Let Go
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I met you in the dark
You lit me up
You made me feel as though
I was enough
We danced the night away
We drank too much
I held your hair back when
You were throwing up

[Pre-Chorus]
Then you smiled over your shoulder
For a minute, I was stone cold sober
I pulled you closer to my chest
And you asked me to stay over
I said, I already told ya
I think that you should get some rest

[Chorus 1]
I knew I loved you then
But you'd never know
'Cause I played it cool
When I was scared of letting go
I knew I needed you
But I never showed
But I wanna stay with you
Until we're grey and old
Just say you won't let go
Just say you won't let go

[Verse 2]
I'll wake you up with some breakfast in bed
I'll bring you coffee
With a kiss on your head
And I'll take the kids to school
Wave them goodbye
And I'll thank my lucky stars for that night

[Pre-Chorus 2]
When you looked over your shoulder
For a minute, I forget that I'm older
I wanna dance with you right now, oh
And you look as beautiful as ever
And I swear that everyday you'll get better
You make me feel this way somehow

[Chorus 2]
I'm so in love with you
And I hope you know
Darling your love is more
Than worth its weight in gold
We've come so far my dear
Look how we've grown
And I wanna stay with you
Until we're grey and old
Just say you won't let go
Just say you won't let go
[Bridge]
I wanna live with you
Even when we're ghosts
'Cause you were always there for me
When I needed you most

[Chorus 3]
I'm gonna love you till
My lungs give out
I promise 'til death we part
Like in our vows
So I wrote this song for you
Now everybody knows
That it's just you and me
Until we're grey and old
Just say you won't let go
Just say you won't let go

[Outro]
Just say you won't let go
Oh, just say you won't let go
annotations:
[('And you asked me to stay over
 I said, I already told ya
 I think that you should get some rest', [['Patience is extremely important. I think a relationship has to have patience, compromise, respect as well as love and intimacy. As well as being a couple you have to retain your sense of being an individual and be able to have time on your own.']]), ('I’ll wake you up with some breakfast in bed
 I’ll bring you coffee', [['I love eggs, salmon and avocado for breakfast so that’s what I would do for someone else—maybe with fresh orange juice and a coffee and some fresh fruit.

I’m a terrible cook. I could probably manage some scrambled eggs. They’re pretty good scrambled eggs, though. So scrambled eggs, some toast, coffee. It really sounds exotic.']]), ('And I’ll take the kids to school
 Wave them goodbye
 And I’ll thank my lucky stars for that night', [['I’m sure in the future I will have children, though that’s for then. At the moment, I’m loving working on the new album campaign and feel too young to have kids. I have cats, which are sometimes like having kids–when I’m away I have to have someone look after them!

https://www.instagram.com/p/BLw3V_hAubh/

I can’t wait to have a kid. I think it’s going to be a great experience. I don’t know how good I would be at guiding children. I think we have this thing where we want to tell our kids to be careful all the time. And there’s all these scary things out in the world. I don’t think I would do that. I’d say go and take life by the horns and. We have wired fear into children these days. And I don’t want to do that. Take life. Live it as much as you can, because I regret a lot of years where I was scared to go outside and had anxiety and stuff like that. I’m looking forward to teaching my child how to enjoy life.']]), ('We danced the night away
 We drank too much
 I held your hair back when
 You were throwing up', [['It’s something that everyone’s done–I don’t know anyone who hasn’t been in that situation with a friend or lover.']]), ('We danced the night away
 We drank too much
 I held your hair back when
 You were throwing up', [['It’s something that everyone’s done–I don’t know anyone who hasn’t been in that situation with a friend or lover.'], ['Holding someone’s hair back while they’re bent over a toilet, puking, isn’t exactly one of the most romantic situations, but it serves as a testament to true love. It’s easy to be attracted to someone when they’re at their best, but true love is demonstrated by helping them through unpleasant situations like this one.



This is also a common trope used in music to express the meaning of real love, or in some cases, friendship. As Reel Big Fish says in “Everybody’s Drunk”:

A good friend holds your hair back when you puke

In “Marvin’s Room,” Drake raps about doing this for a girl.

Just throw up while I hold your hair back']]), ('I wanna live with you
 Even when we’re ghosts
 ’Cause you were always there for me
 When I needed you most', [['The bridge is about looking at the future and spending your life with someone, even after death. So many people have been moved by the bit in the video where the old man is grieving, but I wanted to think that it’s not the end.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0yW7w8F2TVA

It’s hard to tow the line and not be too cheesy, but when you find that one person, you see that as forever. Even after you pass away, your spirit is with that person.']]), ('I knew I loved you then
 But you’d never know
 ’Cause I played it cool
 When I was scared of letting go
 I knew I needed you
 But I never showed
 
 But I wanna stay with you
 Until we’re grey and old
 Just say you won’t let go
 Just say you won’t let go', [['The inspiration was to look at someone’s life and the path through it with a partner. Some of it is personal and some of it is inspired by people around me as well as imagining what life is like in other people’s relationships.

I’m writing songs that are relatable–songs that anyone at any age can see themselves in and understand.

As always, I just try and paint a picture. I think it’s very easy to fall in love, but to maintain it and sustain it… These days, people seem to get together and then it doesn’t last. Maybe it last a couple of years. I’m trying to convey how powerful love can be, and when you first fall in love with someone, you feel like you want to be with them forever. We should hold onto that. If I got married now, I’d want that to be for life. I don’t know. I haven’t thought about it that much. I just wanted to make people feel something.']]), ('And you look as beautiful as ever
 And I swear that everyday you’ll get better
 You make me feel this way somehow', [['As they grow older, his love for her does not wane, nor does her beauty, both growing in grace as they age – she made him feel that he was good enough as he is, and that astounds him even after all these years.']]), ('When you looked over your shoulder
 For a minute, I forget that I’m older
 I wanna dance with you right now, oh', [['He still feels like he’s his younger self, and he wants to dance with her just as joyfully as he did in their youth, but his aged body is prohibiting him from doing so.']]), ('I met you in the dark
 You lit me up
 You made me feel as though
 I was enough', [['This verse opens with a double meaning. On the one hand, the couple literally met in a dimly lit place (from the references to drinking and dancing, likely a party or a club), but this person’s personality was shining.

On the other hand, the speaker met their partner when he was “in a dark place,” metaphorically, and their partner helped to counter that darkness. “You made me feel as though I was enough” can mean they helped him feel secure in their relationship (that he was “enough” for them), but it also probably relates to the speaker’s internal self-confidence which was strengthened by their partner (that he was “enough” as he was).']])]

name: Put Your Records On
lyrics:
[Verse 1]

You go ahead, let your hair down
Sapphire and faded jeans, I hope you get your dreams
Just go ahead, let your hair down

[Post-Chorus]
You're gonna find yourself somewhere, somehow

[Bridge]
'Twas more than I could take, pity for pity's sake
Some nights kept me awake, I thought that I was stronger

annotations:
[('And I don’t want the world to see me
 ’Cause I don’t think that they’d understand
 When everything’s made to be broken
 I just want you to know who I am', [['As the song reaches its ultimate epoch and high-point, Dilly P realises that he must confess his love to his girl. He runs out of his house into the storm, his friends follow after him. They attempt to stop him, but one says to the others ‘No, let him go, this is what he needs to do’. The rain falls down hard and lightning strikes as Dilly reaches full stride down Hereford road. As this happens, the camera cuts to a scene of Marky P taking the last drags out of his fag, sitting in his favourite chair, just as he begins to drift into his final slumber of death – he dies happy knowing that his son will proclaim his love. Dilly continues his run as his face becomes flushed and he briefly stops to chunder in a bush – overcome with alcohol and ketamine. He pauses for a brief moment, before exclaiming ‘THIS IS A VIBE!’ and then running into the night, to show his love that they belong together and that he is unable to cope without her.']]), ('And I don’t want the world to see me
 ’Cause I don’t think that they’d understand', [['It can be extremely scary to be vulnerable in a world that can sometimes be harsh and judgmental.

Emotions are a troubling thing and are easy to misunderstand and because of that, the desperation to hide them. He doesn’t want the world to see him vulnerable or hurting.

In the next piece of lyrics his realization of the fact that – nothing lasts. Everything is going to come to an end soon or break and decides to let his emotions known.']]), ('When everything’s made to be broken', [['Here the speaker acknowledges the fact that nothing was made to last. Everything comes to an end eventually and having made that realization, he has decided to show who he really is.']]), ('I just want you to know who I am', [['Even through “everything’s made to be broken”, he is still reaching out for a relationship with her. This is actually very positive as it shows that love exists even if a person knows it will not will not live forever or eternally. He knows the nature of impermanence in relationships, but continues to want her to know who he is, even though all is made to be broken. (we forget things we learned in school, for instance) Yet, he wants her to know who he is regardless… this shows true love.']]), ('I just want you to know who I am
 I just want you to know who I am
 I just want you to know who I am', [['Being so close to realizing that things can be within one’s own reach is peaceful. Showing one’s true self and that being acknowledged, is satisfaction and joy.']]), ('And all I can taste is this moment
 And all I can breathe is your life
 And sooner or later, it’s over
 I just don’t wanna miss you tonight', [['He wants to live the present, because their love might end at any time. When he says, “and all I can breathe is your life,” he means that he wants to spend as much as he can with his loved one until the time they have together is over.']]), ('And you can’t fight the tears that ain’t coming
 Or the moment of truth in your lies
 When everything feels like the movies
 Yeah, you bleed just to know you’re alive', [['You can fight through the difficult patches of a relationship if you know things will get better. But once you reach the point we’re you’re numb to arguments, you can no longer lie to improve the situation, and you start feeling that the relationship is monotonous and scripted, you almost wish your lover would hurt you again just so you can feel something.



Ironically, Tyler Durden of the movie Fight Club has a similar philosophy. He burns the main character’s hand with a chemical to prove a point to him: without the feeling of pain, we are dead.']]), ('You’re the closest to heaven that I’ll ever be
 And I don’t wanna go home right now', [['This line becomes much more interesting when you consider the context. It was written about Nic Cage’s angel character in City of Angels who gives up being an angel to be with a human lover. This line shows that she is so special to him that he feels closer to heaven when he’s with her than when he was actually living in heaven.



But, even without the context, it’s clear that the girl in this song makes her lover feel like they are becoming a better person.']]), ('And I’d give up forever to touch you
 ’Cause I know that you feel me somehow', [['There is a parallel here to the plot of the movie, City of Angels, which this song was written for. In this movie, Nicolas Cage’s angel character becomes human and throws away immortality just to be with his love.']])]

[('Watching every motion in my foolish lover’s game
 On this endless ocean, finally lovers know no shame
 Turning and returning to some secret place inside
 Watching in slow motion as you turn around and say', [['This metaphor for longing might be quite literal in the context of Top Gun, where the protagonist is a Naval aviator deployed on the other side of the world from his home base – and in this song, from his lover, hanging her desire on her memories of him and his last words and (distant) known positions.']]), ('Through the hourglass I saw you
 In time you slipped away
 When the mirror crashed I called you
 And turned to hear you say
 “If only for today, I am unafraid”', [['In the context of Top Gun, this song is about the inherent tension of a military relationship. One partner may be deployed for many months out of the year, or for years at a time, affording precious little contact with family (especially in the 1980s).

This can take an exasperating psychological toll on the spouse of a warfighter, who is often forced to confront not only loneliness but profound fears of abandonment and jealousy.

But it can be just as difficult for the “away” partner, who may need to process these issues as well as the myriad traumas of military conflict.']]), ('Take my breath away', [['Kiss me so deeply and passionately that I nearly stop breathing']])]

[Instrumental]

And she looks perfect, and he looks perfect
No, I don't deserve this

annotations:
[('We are still kids, but we’re so in love', [['Beyoncé does a present-tense rendition of an earlier Sheeran lyric from the first verse: instead of focusing on how they were kids when they fell in love, she brands herself and Jay as still childish but in love. Certainly the circumstances of her relationship’s beginnings are different: Jay is 12 years older than her, and both were well into maturity when they started dating around 2003. 14 years into their relationship and 3 children later, Bey & Jay’s love for each other is still burning strong with the virility of a young couple but the durability of a mature one.']]), ('Fightin’ against all odds
 I know we’ll be alright this time', [['Beyoncé and Jay-Z’s relationship history has been pretty rocky, from elevator fights to cheating confessions.

Many times before, in both Beyoncé and Jay-Z’s music, they’ve referenced these hard times. In an interview with The New York Times, Jay-Z states,

We were using our art almost like a therapy session.

In “Perfect,” this line is almost like a therapy session for Beyoncé. It’s a sigh of relief for her. She has hope that their relationship will make it through all the hard times.']]), ('Barefoot on the grass, listening to our favourite song', [['“Perfect” was written for Sheeran’s girlfriend, Cherry, and the “favourite song” he mentions is actually Future’s “March Madness.”

In an interview with Entertainment Tonight Canada, Sheeran explained the inspiration behind the line:

The song that we’re listening to is Future’s ‘March Madness,’ which is  like, the least romantic song in the world. We were in Ibiza at James Blunt’s house and for some reason, there was a certain point in the night and people just put on house music. I just don’t like house music at all—at all!  So I changed it to Future’s “March Madness” and there were a bunch of 40 year old people like, ‘What are you doing? What is this?’ And then we had a dance.']]), ('Baby, I’m dancing in the dark with you between my arms', [['Ed has explained numerous times that the reason his previous relationships didn’t work out is because he never had any time. The singer recently took a year off to spend more time with Cherry.

Now, the bond between them has grown even stronger and he’s found a balance between work and his personal life. He now has time to dance with his girl, go on dates, and do normal things.']]), ('’Cause we were just kids when we fell in love
 Not knowin’ what it was
 I will not give you up this time', [['Ed and Cherry Seaborn, his girlfriend, have a long history together. They both went to the same high school in Suffolk, and he may have had a crush on her when they were younger.

In 2016, after being in a long distance relationship with Ed, Cherry moved from the U.S. back to the UK to spend more time with him.

Ed has hinted in many interviews and in his songs that he’s considering marriage and kids, and this line only further confirms his commitment to Cherry.']]), ('Well, I found a girl, beautiful and sweet
 Oh, I never knew you were the someone waitin’ for me', [['His current wife Cherry went to his high school, and they were actually quite close friends. Ed dropped out, became super successful, and became homesick. Ed’s since returned to his hometown and has found love where it always was, waiting for him.

He also explores themes of homesickness and remembering his past on “Castle on the Hill”.']]), ('I found a love for me
 Oh darling, just dive right in and follow my lead', [['Ed incorporates the title of the album’s third track, “Dive,” and mimics a couplet from “Shape of You”:

Come on now, follow my lead
I may be crazy, don’t mind me

On both “Shape Of You” and “Perfect,” Ed initially takes a more dominant position, both in dancing (“Shape of You”) and in beginning a relationship (“Perfect”). This suggests that he was the first one to make a move, and possibly the first to fall in love.']]), ('To carry love, to carry children of our own', [['Beyoncé and Jay Z have carried children of their own. Their daughter, Blue Ivy, has already made her musical debut and is arguably the most famous child of a celebrity.

As of recently, Beyoncé’s newborn twins, Rumi and Sir, have been getting a lot of buzz. The couple has been low-profile with their new children, so any spotting of the twins gets attention.']])]

name: Can't Help Falling in Love
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Wise men say only fools rush in
But I can't help falling in love with you
Shall I stay? Would it be a sin
If I can't help falling in love with you?

[Chorus]
Like a river flows
Surely to the sea
Darling, so it goes
Some things are meant to be

[Verse 2]
Take my hand, take my whole life, too
For I can't help falling in love with you

[Chorus]
Like a river flows
Surely to the sea
Darling, so it goes
Some things are meant to be

[Outro]
Take my hand, take my whole life, too
For I can't help falling in love with you
For I can't help falling in love with you
annotations:
[('Would it be a sin
 If I can’t help falling in love with you?', [['Simply falling in love with someone, whether she feels the same way or not, is nowhere near a “sin”.

Him referring to it as one hints he is asking if it would be a sin if he stayed, as in “stayed the night”.']]), ('[Verse 1]', [["In Blue Hawaii, Elvis sings this song not to his girl, but to her grandmother whom he brought back a music box from Europe for her birthday.

Elvis' character claims that “Can’t Help Falling in Love” is an old European love song. We learned in an earlier song, “Almost Always True”, that he was in France. So it is likely that the lyrics he sings wouldn’t be the lyrics of the fictional original “European love song”."]]), ('Like a river flows
 Surely to the sea
 Darling, so it goes
 Some things are meant to be', [['All bodies of water eventually end up in the ocean. The water was meant to end up in the ocean. In his eyes, he and his lover are the same.']]), ('Take my hand, take my whole life, too
 For I can’t help falling in love with you', [['Going back to the very first line of the song “Wise men say only fools rush in”, he here demonstrates that he really is being rather foolish by being willing to trust a woman he probably has not known for very long (considering that he is just falling in love with her) with his life.

“Take my hand, take my whole life too”

Look how quickly it escalates. First he is just asking her to take his hand (not a sin, not rushing in), but in the next line he is telling her to take his whole life.

He is surrendering to the inevitability of falling in love with this woman and choosing to give up his whole life for her.']]), ('Wise men say only fools rush in
 But I can’t help falling in love with you', [['The “Memphis Mafia” say that only fools fall in love but Presley can’t avoid the same.

The phrase is first known from An Essay on Criticism by Alexander Pope.

“No place so sacred from such fops is barr’d,
Nor is Paul’s church more safe than Paul’s churchyard:
Nay, fly to altars; there they’ll talk you dead:
For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.”']])]

name: Careless Whisper
lyrics:
[Intro]
Time can never mend
The careless whispers of a good friend
To the heart and mind, ignorance is kind
There's no comfort in the truth, pain is all that you'll find
Should have known better, yeah

[Instrumental]

[Verse 1]
I feel so unsure
As I take your hand and lead you to the dance floor
As the music dies, something in your eyes
Calls to mind a silver screen and all its sad goodbyes

[Chorus]
